data.title: Minister
data.text: This really authentic Mexican food at a reasonable price. They are open from 7-4 PM and the wait staff is bi-lingual. It is a favorite place for many winter Texas to eat. On Saturday they have a person playing music. If you want to eat on a Sunday I suggest you arrive early as church groups start arriving about 12. They have a gracious amount of parking.

data.title: delicious food
data.text: i am from the area , but for those who are not , this food is really original tex-mex cuisine at it best, service is awesome and owners make you feel at home

data.title: Best food in Town!
data.text: This is the Best Mexican Food in town!!  The food is great with nice size portions making it a great value. This is No #2 Las Margarita and it's in a cool old gas station! We liked that they saved this old building. Great waiter very friendly and fast!

data.title: good food
data.text:
have eaten here many times in the past.  usually for brunch,
service is good  food was tasty  didn't have any complaints

data.title: Very good
data.text: We spent three weeks in RGV and tried several Mexican restaurants. This was one of most tasty. Had a chili releno along with chalupa and taco I think. Releno was the second best I have ever had. The best being at Rossario's in San Antonio.  Good food and good service. I should mention that this was #2 Las margaritas.

data.title: Really enjoyed the Caldo de Res.
data.text: I stopped here with my mother because she wanted some soup. Not just any soup but Caldo de Res. She told me that they made it just like hers. We both ordered and we were not disappointed. It was just like moms. Some fresh tortillas and limes made this so good. I was really impressed with the amount of meat in the soup. The service was good and the atmosphere was pleasant.

data.title: Our Favorite Restaurant in Pharr
data.text: This restaurant is a little more expensive than some of the other restaurants in the area, but the portions are large and everything is very good. My wife has only one thing she orders because she has not found any place that makes that is as good as Las Margaritas. I like everything, the chips, the salsa, all the enchiladas(except the cheese),   tacos, the chicken dishes(which are large), seafood, breakfast, and the soups. We eat there a lot and can't imagine it is not on Trip Advisor.
